pronunciation: KIN'DLE, [Latin accendo; from the root of candeo, caneo, to be light or white, to shine.]

definitions.text:
Kindle
1. To set on fire; cause burn with flame; light; as, kindle fire.
2. To inflame, as passions; exasperate; rouse; provoke; excite action; heat; fire; animate; as, kindle anger wrath; kindle resentment; kindle flame love, love into flame.
So is contentious woman kindle strife. Proverbs 26:21.
3. To bring forth.
KIN'DLE,

To take fire; begin burn with flame. Fuel fire well laid, will kindle without bellows.
1. To begin rage, violently excited; roused exasperated.
It shall kindle thickets forest. Isaiah 9:18
Â 
Editors Note: There is error this entry which comes original historical text. The reference Proverbs 26:21 should read: So is contentious man kindle strife.
